bug.short_desc: Bug with multiple simultaneously open drop down lists of ComboBox

long_desc.thetext:
Thanks, but a few questions:
- You write "It is possible ..." - so what's the issue?! Do you mean "It is *not* possible ..."?
- What is a "dd list of ComboBox"?
- Your Playground code runs fine - what is it that you want to achieve? Can you provide a failing example?

(In reply to comment #1) > Thanks, but a few questions: > > - You write "It is possible ..." - so what's the issue?! Do you mean "It is > *not* possible ..."? > > - What is a "dd list of ComboBox"? > > - Your Playground code runs fine - what is it that you want to achieve? Can you > provide a failing example?
Thomas, thanks for the reply!
dd list = drop down list. Here's how you can reproduce the bug (if it is really a bug): *In IE9 in playground run the attached code (it just created three Combos each having three options). * Click on the first then on the second then on the third (and in back order) and see that sometimes drop down list is being not closed when the combo loses focus i.e. when you click on the next combo its drop down (dd) is opened but the previous combo's dd haven't been closed.
The reason I thought that it is a bug is because it is reproducible only in IE, i.e. all other browsers always close drop down list when a combo loses focus.
